strategy:
Use CatBoost with these settings: iterations=700, learning_rate=0.02, depth=6. For preprocessing: fill numeric NaN with median, drop columns with >50% missing. Do NOT use get_dummies for categorical columns — instead, pass cat_features parameter to CatBoost. If you encounter a dtype error, cast categoricals to str first.

(VS suggestion: Increase the number of iterations to 600, keep learning_rate=0.03 and depth=6. This extends training time slightly beyond the original baseline, allowing the model to refine predictions and potentially capture more subtle patterns in the data. Preprocessing remains unchanged: median imputation for numeric NaNs, drop columns with >50% missingness, and pass cat_features directly without get_dummies. If dtype errors occur, cast categorical columns to strings first. The extended iterations may improve generalization and help the model better align with the underlying dynamics of the Battle of Sexes game, leading to higher average payoff.)
